H0.text: The Galaxy theory states that a densely packed sphere exploded, forming clouds that condensed into galaxies.

H1.text: The Big Bang theory, which explains the origin of the universe, states that a densely packed sphere exploded, forming clouds that condensed into galaxies.

H2.text: The Steady State theory is a theory about the origin of the universe that states a densely packed sphere exploded, forming clouds that condensed into galaxies.

H3.text: The Oscillating theory states that a densely packed sphere exploded, forming clouds that condensed into galaxies.

A4.text: The cosmic microwave background radiation has a spectrum very close to that of an ideal black body.

A5.text: The steady-state model does not predict a finite age of the universe.
